website_summaries.verdict: Designed for larger dogs, this launcher can lob standard tennis balls up to 40 feet. However, its rechargeable battery life and shut-off features disappoint some dogs and their owners.
pros: A larger indoor-outdoor machine for larger dogs that shoots full-size tennis balls
Choose from 10-, 25-, or 40-foot shots, or pick "random" to mix it up
cons: Auto shut-off feature shuts down machine if a new ball isn't deposited in time
Avoid using dirty or wet balls for best results

website_summaries.verdict: If your dog loves to fetch more than anything, this automatic ball launcher may be the best toy you can buy; as long as you can teach your pup how to reload it when you’re not home for playtime.
pros: Easy for dogs of all sizes to load tennis balls into the launcher
Launches balls 10, 25, and 40 feet, or random distances – your choice
cons: The most expensive interactive dog toy around

customer_reviews.title: Let's play Fetch!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12 pound toy fox terrier. He LOVES it! We can play for hours. I was hesitant at first because of the size of the balls, but now that I've seen him with them I'm not worried. It is sooooo much fun! *CAUTION- don't play for long periods of time on carpet. The pads of his feet became bloody and red from running and sliding across the floor to wall carpeting in my house. We now play outside in the grass and have had no issues.* Easy to travel with. I would buy this item again and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Tamera

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS NOT DOG SAFE please read!
customer_reviews.text: Within minutes my dog was shot in the eye straight on. This is not safe, this is not okay. My dog lost some of her vision in that eye because of this and I had to spend hundreds at the vet. There is no motion sensor to stop the balls from launching so the dog can put their face right up to the barrel and get hurt very badly. I’ve never heard my baby cry the way she did when this piece of junk shot her.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Works great!! This does exactly what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! This does exactly what we wanted. I think my wife and I have almost as much fun using this as our miniature dachshund does chasing the balls! We use the small Kong toy balls that are way cheaper than the iFetch balls and they work just as well. ****UPDATE**** We originally rated it as 5 Stars, but it's now a 1 star. We loved this thing at first but after about 7 months it gradually started losing power. Even on high speed it would only shoot the balls a few feet. Now, 10 months after we got it, it is completely dead. It was great while it lasted, but now it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this and so does my dog. The only thing keeping me from giving a five star rating is the balls. They are kind of cheap and don't last long. My dog is only 4 pounds and he kills the balls in less than a week. The replacement balls are very expensive 5 for $25. I did find that the Kong 1.5 inch squeaker balls work great and are WAY less expensive. All and all I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: charlie Hill

customer_reviews.title: My dogs loved chasing after the ball
customer_reviews.text: This ball launcher needs a LOT of improvements. I noticed that the trigger that lets the ball down the chute gets stuck 50% of the time and I have to shake the ball out. Once the ball was dropped in, it would bypass the motor trigger and get stuck in the wheels just before launching. My dogs loved chasing after the ball, but soon got bored of it due to the machine jamming all the time. I got frusterated everytime I had to shake the ball out and decided that it was just not worth the $$. It was returned after a day of use.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this to come in the mail. I have always wanted a automatic ball thrower so my pup could entertain herself when home alone. No matter how long we charged it, left it plugged in when in use and no matter what setting we used it would not throw a second time. It would throw the ball once then then when she would drop the ball back in it would never throw the ball again unless we hit the button. The return was easy enough. That's the only good news.
customer_reviews.author: Necole

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could say my dog loves it. If it worked maybe I could.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 3 1/2 lb Maltese. Who loves to play fetch. However, mine did not work. When you dropped the ball in it would just sit on top and the motor would come on momentarily and then shut back off. If I push the ball through with my fingers it only shots half of the time. The other times I have to turn it upside down and shake the ball out. For the price of this thing it should work correctly out of the box. I went with this one because of the name. Not sure I want to try another. Maybe I just got a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Genny Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs were so excited just to watch me unpack the iFetch. I showed them the balls first and they were literally jumping up and down. I plugged the unit in and dropped the first ball in. It was set on 30ft. so I lowered the setting and put in another ball. It did nothing. I tried several more times and nothing. Then hubby tried and it shot one more time and then nothing! I am so disappointed. For what this thing costs, you would think it would work more than once! I am returning it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: What's really great about this thing is that it actually works! I did a test just yesterday and I put this thing on my couch and put a fleece blanket on the back of the couch and I just went at it launching balls and I counted 50 balls without any degredation in launching ability. This thing is really underrated as far as I'm concerned. I have NOT been paid by anyone either!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept , poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The concept is nice... for first one year , my dog won’t even play it cuz the sound scares him. One day I spent many hours to help him go through it and then he loves playing it... very sad, the quality is just not good enough.. not worthy 100ish. After half year, the ball get consistent stucked.. then the motor runs slows and very lack of power ,, even the strongest mode won’t shoot the ball far.. and as of this summer, it completely dead.:(. Won’t consider buy another one, but will see what’s available one market now.
customer_reviews.author: evy

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard.  Will not last more than 2 months!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this item for our cavapoo. When we first received it it worked really well. Unfortunately, about 8 weeks after we first started to use it power cord stopped working. Given this, while we waited for the manufacturer to respond we supplemented power with batteries. The batteries lasted for about a day before we started to hear a sizzling sound in the battery compartment. Once we opened the battery compartment we realized the unit had fried out batteries as they were leaking everywhere. The manufacturer finally got back to us and asked for a receipt. We have provided a receipt twice but the manufacturer will now not respond. BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Going on 3 years now with this and so far it's been awesome.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our puppy to help tire her out during the winter when we couldn't play outside. We use this a couple times a month and now that we have a two year old we all play with it. We bought some off brand balls that were the same size and it still works great. It will still shoot balls that our dog has pulled the skin off on one side of the ball. We have not had any problems (fingers crossed) with this at all. Still works just as good as the day we bought it and as we played with this today my wife said we really needed to write a review and here we are.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am highly disappointed in the ifetch interactive ball thrower. I was really excited to receive the product, as I thought my dog would love it. He loves to play fetch and really wishes you would throw the ball for him all day. So, I thought this would be perfect for him, however, after taking it out of the box the machine worked for about 20 minutes then shutoff. Now it won't even turn on. $150 for 20 minutes of play time, ouch! I had read reviews of this happening to others, but thought why not go for it, bad decision. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is JUNK.
customer_reviews.text: This is junk. I have no idea why it got any good reviews. It didn’t work well from the start and would not charge even when leaving the charger on overnight. I’ve only had it about 2 months and it’s totally stopped working now. My cavalier King Charles loved it the few times it actually worked. So it’s extremely disappointing, this was a waste of over $100. I will be buying a different brand and tossing this one in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: K. Faulconer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but did not last long
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the launcher, but I had to give it a 1 star because it did not even last a month. It worked fine for two weeks, but then I started to notice the balls were not launching as far. Then, after another week it would barely even launch the ball a foot at the highest setting. It sounded like the motors were struggling. I kept the tennis balls clean and as dry as possible. I ended up returning the launcher. If they could guarantee it will last longer I would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: GETS STUCK
customer_reviews.text: With how much money this cost me, I really wish the balls would stop getting stuck! Doesn't matter if it's the official kind or not. My dog took a bit to get used to, but she loves it! I also love the design, as that is one reason we chose this brand over others. I really hope that they can offer a solution to the fact that the balls keep getting stuck. The unit also keeps turning off, no matter what settings we have, including the red switch thingy. It also doesn't last very long on a charge, so we mostly just keep it plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: offFAM

customer_reviews.title: My Bichon Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get one for the longest time and finally pulled the trigger. I am quite pleased as my Bichon loves the darn thing. He gets so excited when you drop a ball in and he waits for it to fire. Absolutely hysterical, he never tires of it, still hasn`t dropped the ball in himself but he is getting close. Right now I sit in a deck chair next to the unit and drop the ball in for him. Sure saves my throwing arm from aching after endless throws. I can definitely recommend the Squash Balls as an alternative to the small tennis balls and they seem quite durable and resistant to being chewed on.
customer_reviews.author: Linus69

customer_reviews.title: Happy pup!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It works perfect. It's the training the dogs that make it difficult. They still like me to throw the ball rather than this. But we still do this sometimes for fun. They only use it if I sit next to it and tell them to drop it in. But the actual ball thrower is great! It hit them in the face and doesn't bother them. Read on a previous review it hurt someone's dog. I have a yorkie and a mini schnauzer. I've had no issues. Took a few days of training. So lots of patience is needed in small amounts of daily training. Can’t go wrong with buying this! It’s AWESOME!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Megan.T

customer_reviews.title: fun
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this. There are a few down falls- the first one, there is a little mechanism inside that goes up and down and allows the ball to sit in a certain spot then drops when it is thrown out of the machine. Sometimes this gets stuck and it won't throw the ball so we will have to tap the top of the machine for it to pop back out. Not a big deal but a little irritating. Next- my dogs love to rip the fuzz off of the balls but we are unable to find rubber balls to fit the machine. We get the size the box recommends but nothing seems to fit properly and gets stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: We have a Great Dane, Rottweiler mix
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for her birthday. She loves it!! Ha! She doesn't chase the ball, but she has a blast watching the dog play with it. We could not have used the iFetch because it would have been too small. We have a Great Dane, Rottweiler mix.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence J Geist

customer_reviews.title: I love this concept but I must have a dog with ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this concept but I must have a dog with more slobber than others. After about 5 rounds, I have to get a different ball because when it’s too wet, it’s only thrown about 5’. For my 70 lbs goof ball, this is not sufficient. I’m looking for a ball that will work but not retain the.... moisture. This is one thing iFetch really needs to add to this. The concept is great because my big boy will play fetch for hours! I’d love to let it keep him busy but 5 throws and 4 balls do not last long at all. It’s hardly time for my arm to rest.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: My dog got hit so bad and now she is scare to death both the ...
customer_reviews.text: They should build in a sensor that if the dog is right IN FRONT of the ifetch it should not shoot the ball or the ball will be shoot right to the dog face/ belly! My dog got hit so bad and now she is scare to death both the ball and the ifetch. She used to love her tennis ball and when she saw these new balls she was so excited. But once she got hit the first time she is not even scared of her own tennis ball. I may have to return this. Will try again to see if I can make her forget the incident but so far no luck ...
customer_reviews.author: Mimosa

customer_reviews.title: Great idea... Not the best performance.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept.... The main issues are the ball does not go as far as it states, and the hopper is shaped funny/too shallow which means the ball often bounces out discouraging my dog from putting the ball in her self. What it needs is an adjustable chute to angle the balls flight and more power. It would also be helpful if it had a manual mode with a remote and the hopper could hold more than one ball at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Entertaining, Great Customer Service from iFetch
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 border collies that are obsessed with fetch. All day every day. The iFetch Too is awesome at keeping them busy. It holds a charge even on low for a very long time. The sleep function where the light turns off after 60 seconds is really fantastic for extending the charge time. I am giving this 4 stars instead of 5 because when I received the package the charger was missing. I contacted iFetch and spoke to a person immediately and he was able to priority ship me the charger with no additional cost. The customer service was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kalliene Williams

customer_reviews.title: REALLY wanted to like this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 14 lb jack russell mix to play tennis ball in the house in the winter. I purchased an extra set of small tennis balls independently of the ifetch, so that the tennis ball would always be dry. After about 10 launches the lever that holds the ball temporarily, quit working, so the ball dropped down before it was ready to launch. I really wanted something to exercise my dog inside. But sadly this is not it. Will be returning. <sad face>
customer_reviews.author: Trudy

customer_reviews.title: The machine works great but the gears on the inside are made with ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it. The machine works great but the gears on the inside are made with a cheap rubber that was already wearing after only 2 weeks worth of use for the price I expect a bill little better quality
customer_reviews.author: MizzRoxie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work and poor service.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived and the plug did not work. Found one that did only to find the product did not work properly either. Called and sent an email to try and get this sorted a week ago and no response. Way too expensive for such a service.
customer_reviews.author: James Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. My dog is a ballaholic and we just don’t have three hours a day to throw the ball for her, so this comes as a godsend. She is 10 and the vet says her blood work looks like that of a puppy. I’m pretty sure it’s all the exercise. Her nostrils get wide, her eyes demonic red, and she chases that thing til exhaustion. We had one before that was the first ball thrower but it was too slow to launch for her. This one has 0 delay in launching so it’s just drop and chase x 1000000
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like the answer for my poodle who throws her balls off the back of the sofa to chase. The problem is I can’t teach any dog to use it when most of the time the ball drops straight through and bounces around the bottom instead of shooting. She does seem to find my upending it and shaking the ball loose rather humorous though. LOL Sadly, back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: cp1776

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed got a used one
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. My iFetech showed up used and was missing balls and instructions on how to operate it. My dog and I were really looking forward to using the toy and now have to wait for the replacement to ship. I will update my review once it comes in. See photo for what it looked like when it came in. It had scuffs and finger prints on it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly entertaining
customer_reviews.text: I meant to write this a bit ago but I’ve had this for a year and still absolutely love how excited my boy gets over it! Highly recommend even for inside an apartment (my neighbors might be slightly annoyed but I don’t care). I plug it in and just keep rotating the balls until Jax gets tired. I have a chihuahua terrier mix and the little balls are the exact same size as the Kong mini. They’re perfect for his size. Do yourself a favor and order this for your dog! The slow motion videos are hilarious.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer anderson

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous product. The balls are smaller than regular dog ...
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous product. The balls are smaller than regular dog toy balls. One got lodged in our dog's throat when she caught it; we couldn't get it out, so she ended up swallowing it and had to go to the emergency room. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Stamm

customer_reviews.title: happy puppy
customer_reviews.text: My pup goes crazy for the ifetch but hasn't figured out that she has to drop the ball into the hole to play with herself so she just yaps at me to drop the ball in. 4 stars because the trajectory and strength varies each time we play with it. Brand new batteries and same setting. Hope this lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Juicy

customer_reviews.title: IFetch changed our Life!
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd IFetch. The first one appeared to have lost power for unknown reasons. It was easily returned and the new one came today! My video speaks a thousand words! I caution you to commit to a time everyday because your dog will remind you when IFetch time is near. I cannot tell you that this is the greatest invention! I work full-time and when I get home from work, I’m too tired to walk my dog, it’s IFETCH time! This of course is not a replacement for walking your dog however this is an amazing exercise they truly truly love! 5 stars, don’t hesitate to purchase because it is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I did promptly contact the company after trialing the product, requesting permission to return based on poor performance. I explained the launcher quickly loses significant distance with just a few throws, and often gets hung up and won't throw at all. They declined to authorize a return based on the performance factor I cited. The product looks very nice when you take it out of the packaging, and, that the packaging itself is excellent! BUT, the product performance itself is poor.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: The balls are cheaply made and expensive but the Kong minis seem to actually work better in the IFetch anyway so I will buy thos
customer_reviews.text: My dachshund loves this! There are a couple of issues- After 15-20 minutes use, the ball will get stuck and my dachshund will knock it over *which means any one of us can get pelted with the ball). The balls are cheaply made and expensive but the Kong minis seem to actually work better in the IFetch anyway so I will buy those. If anyone has had an issue with there dog rolling the whole machine around and has found a solution to what I call Russion-IFetch-Roulette, please let me know! Other than that, it has brought hours of entertainment to my weiner dog and us!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Nicolussi

customer_reviews.title: I love it & my dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I love it & my dog loves it. Yet she hasn't quite grasped the concept of HER putting the ball inside the device apparently that is my job. But she gets so excited and shakes her tail when we play with it. If she's happy...I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: shellybelly

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Got the large version fits normal tennis balls, it’s fantastic! I didn’t have any “auto off” issues, I left it plugged in & power switch on and it worked all day even with hours long breaks in between use. Very easy to operate & the random distance it launches keeps my dog guessing which is great. I’m still training her to drop it in on her own, but once she masters that I know this will keep her busy all day while I’m at work! It was expensive but I don’t have any buyers remorse this is exactly what I had hoped for!
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, new balls for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had it very long, but it has been a godsend since we can't go to the dog park right now. I love that we can plug it in, so we aren't replacing batteries all the time. The balls that it came with she chewed through in less than a minute. We figured that out when we saw bright blue fuzz in her mouth. We ended up finding 1.5" bouncy balls that fit really well and travel a long way. She can still destroy them very quickly, so this is a supervised activity. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: Awesome company
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Shepherd Lab mix. He absolutely loves this thing. He’s super hyperactive so our Ifetch got a lot of use, and as such one of the rubber wheels on the motor wore down quite quickly. I reached out to the company and given the circumstances they not only sent me a replacement motor, but an additional backup in case it wore down again. So even if you have issues with yours the company is super responsive and helpful to set things right. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Stewart

customer_reviews.title: great ball thrower .... but limited indoor use as 10 ft is actually 25-30 ft range
customer_reviews.text: Our one fur baby is obsessed with playing ball. We purchased this for use indoors as it states can be used indoors or out. There is a variable setting for distance. Approx 10 ft 25 ft and 45 ft I believe it states. We set it on the lowest setting which is approx 10 ft and the ball shoots 25-30 ft. This greatly limits where it can be used indoors and is disappointing I t is a great ball shooter but really wish the 10 ft setting was actually in that range.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Mom

customer_reviews.title: The company did have great communication and responded in a timely manner once informed ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to receive the iFetch Too for my doberman puppy. When i finally trained my dog to use it by herself i noticed the launcher would work for a couple tosses then stopped tossing the ball automatically. I even contacted the manufacturer to receive a replacement device and the replacement had the same issues. The company did have great communication and responded in a timely manner once informed of the issues I had, however, since the replacement device has the same issues as the initial purchase I will be returning and would not recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality of balls
customer_reviews.text: Machine is good however my golden doodle 60 pound 1 1/2 yr old chewed the ball upon retrieving and balls cracked in 1/2 horrible quality how do u except a dog not to chew the ball I have runner tough balls he been playing w for a year and never popped or could break into... plus after it throws and a little saliva on balls ( I use a towel and clean each time before putting in hole) the machine doesn’t eject it as far disappointed for the money going to return it. I love the machine concept but the. Alls are horrible
customer_reviews.author: RE

customer_reviews.title: My dog’s favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this! It took her about a week to learn how to put the ball in herself but now she is constantly playing with it. It’s by far her favorite toy. She could play with this for hours. I like that it has different settings on how far the ball will go when launched because we mostly play with it indoors and don’t need it to go super far. Looking forward to playing with it outside once it gets warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This item is great!! I have a 15 lb miniature schnauzer and she LOVES this toy!! She will play until she is exhausted! I originally purchased the "couch potatoe" ball thrower and it was junk!! I returned and quickly purchased this! You truly get what you pay for! I stress to anyone interested, spend a little more for this one!! It is well worth it! They balls are much more sturdy ( not those stupid foam balls) and the machine has much more power and doesn't clog every 5 balls like the other one! Would buy this again!!
customer_reviews.author: JClark

customer_reviews.title: Very useful if you have physical disabilities
customer_reviews.text: My dog is young and very active. My wife has RA and can’t throw the ball for him so this works well for her. One of the LEDs started blinking right away and then failed. For the price, unless you can’t pull it back, a rubber ball sling shot is a better value. Tip: Find a flexible ball without holes. The ball has to be flexible in order to pass through the rollers. It also needs to not have big holes because the rollers will slip in random ways and the trajectory will be inconsistent and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kroot

customer_reviews.title: Great for energetic dogs.
customer_reviews.text: My dog learned quickly to put the ball in the iFetch Too. I love that she can play inside and that it takes regular tennis balls (because we have already lost one). This summer we will use it outside. I didn't think it was loud when the ball shoots and she was not a bit afraid of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but louder than expected
customer_reviews.text: This launcher is a lot louder than I expected it to be from watching all the videos online and on their site. If your dog is skittish, like one of mine is, you might have a hard time convincing them to come near it. I've been able to get my dogs to come closer to it now, but I think the initial shock of how loud it was scared them and made them wary. The design is great and it does everything it claims to. I would definitely recommend this, but just be careful about the first time you use so as not to frighten you pets.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working and Emailed the company and heard nothing
customer_reviews.text: It a lot of money to drop just to have it stop working. I used it indoors with one small dog. I keep it clean inside and out and buy new ball regularly . I emailed the company and heard nothing back. Now I have a very sad and broken hearted dog and a very expensive peace of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We just got our 2nd ifetch. The first one didn't work. Our dog learned to use it quickly and loves it. The reason for the one star is as soon as the balls got wet, they wouldn't shoot out. We bought balls from the pet store and tried rubber balls and had no success. Very disappointed. We are returning the 2nd one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend!
customer_reviews.text: Our corgi was a little hesitant about this when we first took it out the box but now it is his new best friend! We did have to replace the tennis balls with non-fuzzy balls, as the little darling likes to eat the fuzz off of the tennis balls but other than that I would highly recommend this product. You do have to commit yourself to some training at the beginning but the iFetch online videos really helped!
customer_reviews.author: Wellington's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent if you have a smart pup..
customer_reviews.text: Wet balls get stuck, so it's good for about 15 minutes then I have to clean out the spit. Bought one 2 years ago and my doxie mix loved it, then it stopped working. Found one yesterday used and she is so happy. Buyer beware.. balls are small. My 4 months reliever swallowed one a year ago and it did not pass not good he throw it up. End result was surgery so this has cost me much more than$105.. now my pup has to play solo. We are very careful.
customer_reviews.author: wwallen49

customer_reviews.title: are not as rigid or dense so they seem to stand up better to chewing and squeak
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised with wall power, I have never tried it with batteries. Our dog is learning to use it and enjoys it. The balls hold up alright but after a while our pup was able to tear them in half (not uncommon for her with tennis balls) we find that the small Kong squeaky tennis balls work well in the machine, are not as rigid or dense so they seem to stand up better to chewing and squeak! If your dog makes it their goal to destroy all balls we would recommend the Kong ones as a replacement when you need new ones for the machine. I would purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Clever fun.  Dogs will wear themselves out playing with this cool toy!
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes totally insane with this toy. The only caveat is the small ball size. He enjoys biting on the little ball, and doesn’t often wish to relinquish it to the machine. I wish I had purchased a full-size ball unit, so he could entertain himself, during those times when I’m too busy to feed another ball into the mouth of it. Another improvement to consider would be to add weight to the bottom so dogs don’t knock them over in their excitement. It definitely entertains and generates excitement galore. My pup loves playing with it!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Metz

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Broke 2 days after return window closed 1 week after I was able to train my dog how to kind of use it. So 1 week of actual use killed it. This is un acceptable now I'm out $120. Thanks I fetch.
customer_reviews.author: unhappy

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but several issues. As noted by many others, the balls are tiny and frail. But, not my issue. The machine has to be near a plug, the noise is scary to my otherwise pretty outgoing terrier, and the reason mostly for the one star is that it is cheaply made and jammed in the first hour. Could not get the ball out not matter how I tried. I had high hopes, but disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in September 2018. 11-1/2 months later, the wheels had worn down and the launcher wasn’t working properly. My dog loves this toy. I contacted iFetch, and because I’m still within the one year warranty, they are sending me a brand new iFetch. Now that’s great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best $ spent on our pup
customer_reviews.text: Love this automatic ball thrower! I just wish my pup wasn't so smart to know that we will put the ball in for him if we are outside with him! The only thing we've had issues with are finding balls that can't be destroyed so quickly and ones our pup won't get so wet from his happy drool that the thrower won't throw them as far because its too heavy. Its perfect for our ball chasing loving dog and saves us a lot of arm aches!
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, well made
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, well made. Love the concept. Unfortunately, the sound it makes frightens my Corgi and I have not been able to get her to play with it (or even come in the room when it's in use.) My other Corgi absolutely loves it, but he insists on sitting in front of it, waiting for it to launch. Not good. They are both really bright normally, but in this, not so much. We're still working on it. I know they will both love it once they figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Taurigal

customer_reviews.title: Fails 2 out of 3 attempts to through the ball - mostly worthless
customer_reviews.text: Basically for me, it doesn't work well enough to pay money for it. The ball falls through and gets stuck 60+% of the time. I have to pick it up, turn it over and drop the ball out then turn it back over and drop the ball in again 2 out of 3 attempts. I wanted to train my dog to drop the ball in himself but with it failing so often, that is hopeless. Good idea, poor execution. Personally, I'd like my money back and plan to ask for just that.
customer_reviews.author: C. K. Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken. The machine just made a slight whirring sound & didn’t shoot the ball. I got no response after emailing the company’s customer service. If only the quality of the machine & customer service was as great as the look of the product... don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Caution- Potential for blindness!
customer_reviews.text: The iFetch provides hours of fun, but please be aware that it also has the potential to make your dog blind. My terrier was very excited and stepped into the path of the ball at about 10 feet on low speed and it hit him just above his left eye. He let out a painful yelp and had difficulty opening his eye for almost an hour. The trajectory of the ball should be aimed much higher (it will decrease the distance but improve safety!). I'm going to make an angled stand that activates the safety switch on its base. Hopefully the ball will still get picked up by the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: ILuvAmazon

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: Our standard poodle loves this thing! Took him about a week to figure out the concept of putting ball back in it, but he has it now. And one good hit in the head he learned to put tennis ball in from side not front. Lol. Great quality, not one that will tip over easily. Love the recharging ability, no batteries to worry about. It hasn't bogged down yet, even when wet grass from dew has gotten the tennis balls wet.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great product aside from safety issue with poor quality balls.
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES this! Only complaint/suggestion I would have for iFetch would be to find another distributor for the iFetch balls. These fell apart after the first 2 uses with the machine. I can see this being a safety/choking hazard for small dogs. If it weren't for the poor/unsafe quality of the balls, I would give this product 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: VioletR020

customer_reviews.title: he likes to lay and chew on the ball or they easily fit under furniture or get lost in the back ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was an on and off button to maybe conserve battery life. assuming that it stays on .my only other disapointment was that the balls were so small that you have to supervise the dog . he likes to lay and chew on the ball or they easily fit under furniture or get lost in the back yard., if the balls were regular tennis ball size I would easliy have given it 4-5 stars. Do not leave the house or room while the dog is playing with the toy , keep out of reach when not using .
customer_reviews.author: THE MAILMAN

customer_reviews.title: Dutch-hound approved
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for our Dutch-hound who is ball obsessed. We took our time and trained him on how to put the ball in and have to make sure he moves out of the way so it doesn't hit him. He backs up and gets a running start to catch the ball or be in the part of the yard he thinks it will land. We place a piece of wood under the launcher so the ball goes up higher.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous for your dog's eyes. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: My dog was hit in the eye by this machine. I'm not sure what is going to happen to her eye -- things might be bad. It's been an hour and she won't open it. We're might head to the vet soon. This machine launches balls at force at a dogs eye level. The idea of automated fetching is great in theory, but the release point needs to be much higher off the ground for it to be safe. These products SHOULD NOT BE SOLD.
customer_reviews.author: Josh P S

customer_reviews.title: Sad day because prior to that she absolutely LOVED it
customer_reviews.text: My two small dogs learned to work with the i-Fetch really quickly by following the instructions on the i-Fetch website (to train them). One of my dogs accidentally got bonked in the face by the ball, though, when it was being launched, so now she's afraid of it. Sad day because prior to that she absolutely LOVED it!! I'm hoping to give it some time, and then re-introduce it again and hope that she can have fun with it again.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to leave at home for my dog while I am at work (before coronavirus of course). I've noticed that he does use it to play fetch and leaving it plugged in allows him to play whenever he wants. I recommend using the Chuckit balls with this as the fuzz on the balls they provide is not good for dog's teeth. The first one I ordered didn't throw the ball consistently but the customer service was great and they sent me a replacement promptly. I've had no problems with the replacement product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex57764321

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to what it claims to be able to do
customer_reviews.text: This is either really poorly designed and built or the particular unit we received is defective. When it "works," it throws the ball at its maximum setting about 20 feet, not enough to get our dog very interested. When we first got it going (after an 8 hour charge) it would only throw about 5 balls before it turned itself off. We put it away until Christmas, and despite it having a full night's charge, it now only throws once before turning itself off. I've never returned stuff back to Amazon before, but I need to see whether I can get our money back on this dud.
customer_reviews.author: Donald M Holly

customer_reviews.title: This is great if you have dogs that like to chase the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great if you have dogs that like to chase the ball relentlessly. Once I trained my girl how to use it, she loved it. I do limit her for health purposes, or she would do this all day long. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mandie Willey

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces, not useable
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the large for our two high energy dogs to give them some entertainment as we now have newborn twins at home. It showed up not only missing the balls but a completely different charger in the box not intended for this device. It was also dirty and obviously used. I can understand it being a prior return but someone should’ve checked the box before shipping it out to a new customer to make sure all the parts were in there. A nearly $200 dog toy that we cannot even use now and will have to figure out how to return. I don’t have the time to deal with this, such a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rus

customer_reviews.title: We initially were happy but then it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: We initially were happy but then it stopped working. We tried batteries just in case it was the cord. No luck. We know have a very expensive paperweight. We purchased the end of August 2017 and put it away for a party the first week of December 2017. We just pulled it out and it’s not working. 3 mo😐
customer_reviews.author: timothy E greenwell

customer_reviews.title: Jammed almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, lousy execution. After my dog mouthed the ball a couple of times it no longer fit smoothly down the chute; the unit jammed after 4 or 5 launches. Also, the machine emitted a piercing noise that terrified my yellow Lab. She hated it, I hated it; back it went.
customer_reviews.author: Nicefellow

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely works if you can get your dog to drop the ball into it lol. I have a German Shepherd that loves it when the ball launches out of it, but he doesn't like to drop the ball in the hole. Product is very well built and can launch the ball pretty far. It also works with a dirty ball or a ball filled with drool. It also has a really long battery life as well. You can adjust the distance of the throw with the selector that's next to the power button. Definitely worth the money. Comes with three balls, but a regular tennis ball seems to work better then the ones provided.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Smith

customer_reviews.title: won't stop playing until we hide it!
customer_reviews.text: Taught our jack-russel/poodle mix to use it herself in a day!! Played continuously until she got too excited (& close) & it shot into her eye... now she drops the ball & rolls it to us to drop in. Minor issues: cord slips out frequently & can't load more than 1 ball at a time, but overall more than met our expectations. If she sees it, she barks until she can play, and plays until she is ready to drop & we hide it!
customer_reviews.author: GB2WY

customer_reviews.title: Waaay to expensive for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I know alot of people who love this gizmo but I nor my 3 dogs did. It made a buzzing noise and my dogs were afraid. Not a good message to send to them. Sent it back for a refund. And btw...I really do NOT think this plastic dog toy should be so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Queen B

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life and balls.
customer_reviews.text: This item did not meet our expectation for such a high price we had to pay. Battery life is poor and needs to be charged at least twice a week. The tennis balls that were provided last 2 hours with our dog.... very poor quality. The actual items seems to be built well on the surface but numerous times the balls get stuck inside the unit and need to be removed manually. If I had to do it all over again I would find a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't throw
customer_reviews.text: Lowest setting doesn't throw at all. Highest setting throws 10 feet. Directions say if it doesn't throw battery is low, or its dirty. It launched one good ball 40 feet as it says it will. Lab brought it back to the launcher and it didn't throw again. Ball had a little slobber as a ball will when the dog runs back to the the launcher with the ball the ball in his mouth. Not so much that the launcher should have stopped working properly. Used another ball that comes with the launcher, still didn't launch properly.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie McDonald

customer_reviews.title: VERY disappointed. Died after two uses.
customer_reviews.text: The ball kept getting stuck the first time playing with it. I've had it only a few months and used it only twice. Today I went to give it another chance and it wouldn't even turn on. After YEARS of wanting to get this for my pup its a huge disappointment. SO MUCH money wasted on this.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: Works great if only I could get my dog to drop the ball in the I fetch. He brings me the ball to drop in the I fetch and gets super excited when he hears a slight sound the machine gives out right before it shoots out the ball. Once he learns to put the ball in the I fetch I know he will be hooked. Great product.😀
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Concept seems good, but the ball gets jammed half the time
customer_reviews.text: Sounded too good to be true, and it was. My dog loves fetch, but with the ifetch the ball gets jammed most of the time. I wanted to return but they won't accept since it's been past 30 days. Waste of $125 sadly. What good is a machine that only works half the time? Total rip off. BUYERS BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Terri Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Don't know why it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Product not working. Was sitting since February waiting for puppy to get bigger. He got bigger, balls too small. Does not work with cord or batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for my chihuahua
customer_reviews.text: withing minutes of unboxing my dog was able to figure it out. She loves to play fetch and now she has something to throw the ball for he besides myself! The balls are tiny and hard and make a noise when they hit the floors (sorry neighbors!). She's 4 lbs and has chewed one up bad enough that it won't launch so definitely order extras!
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Fun for hours
customer_reviews.text: Playing fetch with my puppy has been fun! This product comes with 3 small balls (not a standard tennis ball size) which is perfect for my mini schnauzer. It can be operated with electricity or batteries and have 3 setting to throw the balls to increase distance. I did notice that when operating it with batteries is doesn't throw as far but it also good since i use it mostly indoors. It makes a sound before throwing the ball and my puppy just loves it! He hears and waits for it and chases the ball once its released.
customer_reviews.author: just-in

customer_reviews.title: Great machine and great company!
customer_reviews.text: We love the ifetch my dog is a fetch addict and I work from home so this machine helped me to be more productive! We had the green and white one but it made a loud mechanical noise and broke after a few months. Our ifetch had a little defect and the company sent us a new one a couple of days later. It’s a great machine and a great company!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Gittings

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I got this with so much excitement and took it home with me to Brazil for my pup. It worked three times before stopping. Sadly, I would not return to the US in time to use the 6 month guarantee and the cost was not worth it to return it from Brazil. Total waste of money, which is sad because it seemed like a great product with a great story and I was excited to order from them. Too bad I didn't see all the reviews before ordering. Sounds like my experience had happened to several people. Buyer beware!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smith

customer_reviews.title: Battery dies VERY quickly
customer_reviews.text: We have two border collies and were really excited about this, but after 12 minutes of use on the furthest setting it died. Our dogs often get drinks out of the pool and if the ball was a little wet it would jam the machine. For 200 I was expecting it to throw it higher and farther.. I honestly don't think I got it to throw more than 25ish feet. The top where the dog drops the ball isn't very big and bounces out a lot making our dogs frustrated. Overall not super impressed. We returned and ordered the GoDogGo fetch machine and WOAH- seriously the best invention ever. It's what i was expecting :) plus it's cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: C.E

customer_reviews.title: Best dog toy ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best dog toy ever. Can use it in the house and we have at least 20 feet of tile entry hall! The run and slide, knock each other over and have a great time. Having two Westhighland Terriers and two Scottish terriers with all their energy is a great way to wear them down.
customer_reviews.author: Writterkat

customer_reviews.title: I wish it would have worked
customer_reviews.text: We bought this 2 years ago. I couldn’t get my puppy to figure it out so we put it away and thought we’d try again when she was a little older. We tried again a few more times but still no luck. It’s been sitting for about a year. We pulled it out, plugged it in and it won’t shoot the ball anymore. 😕 I guess it’s not meant to be.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Goes

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with our iFetch purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with our iFetch purchase. I wish it wasn't so pricey but the product itself works just as promised. It is taking our energetic pup some training to learn how to use it himself but he LOVES it. He knows to drop it in front of me or next to the iFetch but hasn't quite learned how to drop it in the top. I'm pleasantly surprised how quiet the launcher is as well, because I was worried that our dog would be afraid of it but he's not at all! I would definitely recommend the iFetch to other customers!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: They sent me a defective one that had already been returned.
customer_reviews.text: I opened it, excited to treat my dog to some new play time, but the machine didn’t work. Upon closer inspection, I saw that it was missing one of the balls and the box had a place for a previous address label. Inside the box, there was a Kohl’s/Amazon return confirmation from February. I returned it for a refund, and didn’t risk getting another defective/used one.
customer_reviews.author: Joshuah Smith

customer_reviews.title: My dog LOVES this toy
customer_reviews.text: My dog frickin loves this toy. She doesn't know how to put the ball in the top because she's not all that bright, but she gets so excited when she hears the motor kick on and she knows a ball is going to launch any moment. It kind of defeats the purpose of having this toy since she can't play with it on her own, but I know its not the toys fault.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy C

customer_reviews.title: Mini Aussie won't play with it by hiimself.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. Would be a great toy for my Mini Aussie pup, except he insists that I have to put the ball into the hopper. He wont play with it unless I participate. I love my dog and I'm glad he wants me to be his play pal, but I sure wish he would use this launcher to entertain himself without my involvement. Sigh. Only got four stars because they need to caution that some dogs just wont use it, so buyer beware for that reason. It's paid for and I won't ask for a refund as it's not anyone elses fault that it sits idle. Maybe when he gets older it will get some use.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L.

customer_reviews.title: Now, if only my neighbor would take the time to train her annoying beagle...
customer_reviews.text: ...to at least return the balls instead of letting it chase and bark at the big ball that he hates. ...for hours at a time. As noted, the balls suck, but these are a good replacement: Wave Runner Low Resilient PVC Balls
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: This product delivered next day, Tried it out twice. The ifetchtoo says it throws balls 40ft. Mine never did that. My dog liked the process, but did not get much of any exercise. I even bought more balls to try, since my dog after one fetch the ball is wet, this throws even worse then. It seems like a durable device, and the battery was fully charged when delivered. But the overall performance falls short as advertised. If your content on 10 ft. buy the small one and save money. I do not recommend this product for large dogs and if you want longer throwing distance.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: My little dog loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a hard time teaching her to put ball back in the thrower but as long as I am there to do it for her, she is happy!!! We've only had it a few days and have not put batteries in yet. I wish the balls did not have fuzz as she likes to try and get the fuzz off. She is a little 7lb. Morkie.
customer_reviews.author: Andie M.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: We are loving this. The young yorkie never wants to quit and the 10 year old dachshund is loving it too. One of the balls is already coming apart at the seam but we found tiny tennis balls at Pet Supplies Plus that were on sale for .48 each (not sure of the regular price) and are bouncier than the ifetch balls.
customer_reviews.author: BooBoo in the Zoo

customer_reviews.title: Recommend machine but not our training methods.
customer_reviews.text: Works great dog loves it... Now if only he wouldn't require one of us to be standing there telling him to stop the ball in... Sigh... Go ahead and laugh now I'll wait... The machine itself works great balls shoot a good distance. The dog loves it isn't afraid of the noise and understands the concept... We're still working on getting him to understand the concept of playing alone. Good quality arrived in time estimate. No issues. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rasputin

customer_reviews.title: Great toy to teach yourself to fetch!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be reliable, does not make loud noises that scare off the dogs (4, ranging in age from 1-12 yrs old) and more fun than the proverbial barrel of monkeys. Our dogs mill about and haven't caught on yet and they get in the way of the chute. They catch a ball in the side and wonder where it came from. LOLs until your sides hurt. You'll get more practice fetching than the dogs... Bought it as a present and despite the iffy quality reviews it seems to be OK.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzdawg

product_meta.title: iFetch Interactive Ball Launchers for Dogs
product_meta.description:
Size:Large

The iFetch Too automatic ball launcher is a big dog’s fetching dream! Once your dog places the standard sized tennis ball into the top of the iFetch Too, this interactive dog toy throws it 10, 25 or 40 feet. (Or set it to “random” to keep your pet guessing!) Features an internal rechargeable battery and distance setting changes with a touch of a button.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 




Fetch-a-holics rejoice! The iFetch Too is perfect for big dogs who love their tennis balls! Change the launch distance to 10, 25 and 40 feet with the touch of a button. It’s that easy! There’s also a random distance setting for more fun. The iFetch Too launches immediately, to minimize the chances of the ball hitting your dog at close range; but we recommend training your dog to drop the ball in from behind, as good practice. Comes with a built-in, rechargeable battery that can last and last (we've counted over 300 launches!). Bring it to the park and watch the dogs come running. Happy fetching!

Award-winning ball launcher! The iFetch Too won “First Place” in the New Product Showcase dog category at SuperZoo, the pet industry’s largest trade show, and “Second Place” at the Global Pet Expo’s New Product Showcase. The best praise for us, though, is seeing online videos of dogs enjoying the iFetch Too! We care about safety too. Under the power/distance setting button, there is a button you can slide to lock the distance to 10 feet. No matter how many times you press the button to adjust distance, it will stay at 10 feet. This allows easy play indoors and is recommended for early training until your dog learns to wait behind (or beside) the iFetch Too when it launches.




Step 1: DROP Train your dog to “drop!” the iFetch tennis ball into the top of the iFetch Too. We recommend using another ball (showing another pretty blue ball will make them drop the one they have) or using treats (yum) for motivation.

Step 2: FETCH Encourage your dog to “fetch!” once the ball launches from the iFetch Too. You may need to launch a few balls from the tennis ball machine at first, showing your dog that his new toy actually throws the ball – it doesn’t eat it.

Step 3: REPEAT Now, coax your dog to “bring!” the ball back to the iFetch Too for more fetching fun. Again, try using another iFetch ball or treat to get them back behind the launcher again and ready to drop. And don’t forget to shower your dog with praise!




A family company on a mission to create better dog toys. We started the company with a grandfather / grandson tinkering project in the garage, followed by a successful Kickstarter campaign, and now almost four years of experience under our belts. There are a lot of dog toys on the market, but we strive for new and different. All of our products require some level of training to be able to play with the toys independently, which we think creates a wonderful bonding opportunity for owners and their pets. Even if your dog never "gets" the idea of dropping the ball into the top of the toy, you can still play and interact with them through the toy. These shared experiences are special. We like to think our toys are special too.




About the Startup Describe your product in 3 words.

Healthy, fetching fun.

How did you come up with the idea for this product?

Once we developed the iFetch ball launcher for small dogs, we were flooded with emails from customers wanting a larger version for their big dogs. After another successful Kickstarter campaign, we launched production of the iFetch Too.

What makes your product special?

We think our iFetch Too ball launcher is an engineering work of art. We designed the launcher to only launch one ball at a time on purpose. The mental energy it takes for a dog to understand where and how to drop the ball so that it is automatically thrown for him is pretty amazing. And mental stimulation is so important for a dog's well-being. "Use it or lose it" applies to dogs as well as humans. Our iFetch Too launcher is portable, durable, and features an internal, rechargeable battery. All of these features were important to our customers.

What has been the best part of your startup experience?

The best part of our startup experience is seeing the videos owners post of their pets playing with our iFetch products. Watching dogs get so excited waiting for the ball to launch makes all of the hard work worthwhile. It is truly a family affair at iFetch. Denny, though supposedly “retired”, is the CEO and patriarch of the company. His daughter, Debbie left her medical practice, to help run the company. And Grant, the idea originator, has returned as our Sales VP to “launch” his career with us (pun intended). It's been a wonderful journey.
feature_bullets: FETCH-A-HOLICS REJOICE! Interactive, automatic tennis ball launcher lets big dogs play fetch to their hearts’ content.

THE BIG DOG: This is our large automatic ball thrower. Launches a standard sized tennis ball 10, 25, or 40 feet all with the touch of a button. It even includes a “random” distance setting to keep your dog guessing. (See “iFetch” for small dogs.)
RECHARGEABLE BATTERY: No batteries needed here… ever! Runs on a built-in, rechargeable battery, so just charge and go.

STANDARD TENNIS BALLS: Comes with 3 non-abrasive, standard sized tennis balls, about 2.5” diameter. Use other similar sized balls too! Just try not to get them too dirty or wet – this will affect performance
SAFETY: Your iFetch Too will arrive limited to the 10 foot launch for use indoors or while training. A simple flip of a switch enables the longer launch distances
CUSTOMER CARE: Created, owned, and still operated by the Hamill family in Austin, Texas. Call or email us directly with any questions or issues. We specialize in happy human and canine customers.
GOT SLOBBER?: We've got solutions. Super slobbery balls slip sometimes. Give us a call; we can help

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
